Authors: Widianto M.H., Aryanto R., Fadillah C.
Title: Multi-antenna spectrum sensing using bootstrap on cognitive radio for internet of things application
Source title: International Journal of Recent Technology and Engineering
Affiliations: School of Creative Technology, Binus Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Widianto, M.H., School of Creative Technology, Binus Bandung, Indonesia; Aryanto, R., School of Creative Technology, Binus Bandung, Indonesia; Fadillah, C., School of Creative Technology, Binus Bandung, Indonesia
Abstract: Cognitive Radio (CR) is a technology used for other developing technologies like Internet of Things (IoT), one part of CR is spectrum sensing which is useful as an empty spectrum searcher. The use of spectrum is now considered very minimal and raises the problem of scarcity of spectrum. But after testing the real problem is the spectrum in utilization. This problem can be overcome by using efficient utilization of CR technology using Spectrum Sensing. Sensing algorithms that are usually used such as: a suitable filter, energy detector and cyclostationary are not enough because there are many antennas to be detected. In the case of multi-antenna detection, research usually uses the Generalized likelihood ratio test (GLRT) approach. The GLRT Approach Detector also has three types of detectors, type-3 detectors do not determine statistical tests. However, if you use monte carlo or the literacy algorithm, you need a lot of data to get the detector performance. this research will combine algorithms using bootstrap to determine detector performance using small data because using Bootstrap basically only requires a small resampling. The research wants to show if a type-3 detector can help the detector produce good probabilities using little data. The expected result is that the GLRT approach can be combined with a bootstrap for type-3 detectors such as: arithmetic and geometric statistical tests (TAGM) and GLRT time code space code statistical tests (TSTBCGLRT) to help determine assumptions Pd assumptions. Then an experiment was carried out to determine the threshold, by comparing bootstrap with monte carlo, research is expected to show that bootstrap works without a known H0 distribution and set the same threshold at all times. ©BEIESP.

Title: Sound Visualization Using Typography Composition Based GIF
Source title: ICSECC 2019 - International Conference on Sustainable Engineering and Creative Computing: New Idea, New Innovation, Proceedings
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara School of Technology, Visual Communication Design, Bandung, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Fadillah, C., Bina Nusantara School of Technology, Visual Communication Design, Bandung, Indonesia; Rahayu, R.R.A., Bina Nusantara School of Technology, Visual Communication Design, Bandung, Indonesia
Abstract: Visual communication design is a creative communication process, in which it combines art to encode and decode the message. As the technology advances, visual design communication explore further, paving ways to visualize something that doesn't have the visual attribute; sound, something that can only be perceived through auditory senses. The sound is transformed by controlling symbols, images, color movement into an image, using a visual programming software combined with typography composition, to create GIF (Graphic Interchange Format) as the final product. Sound visualization opens the possibility to experience sounds without even hearing it. It is an experimental tool to experience sound, to give an even deeper meaning of a message, and to bridge the possibilities to convey sound to the hearing impairment, those who carry disability, expanding the minds and horizon so they can experience sound. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Acoustic waves; Arts computing; Computer programming; Flow visualization; Sustainable development; Typesetting; Visual communication; Visualization; Communication process; disability; Hearing impairments; Interchange formats; Sound visualization; Technology advances; typography; Visual communication designs; Audition

Authors: Fadillah C., Syamsuddin D., Sasongko R.
Title: The power of perspective on toys photography in one frame story
Affiliations: School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Fadillah, C., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Syamsuddin, D., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sasongko, R., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Toys Photography is a phenomenon that is still prevalent today. The emergence of toys photography has many reasons including the need of stories line as a way to make the toy characters come alive, and also closely related to the world of animation that carries a lot of scenes or stories in the toy industry. The emergence of toy products is also because of film production or advertisement as a medium for distributing the film or as a hobby either from animation and photography world itself. A perspective or viewpoint is very influential for scene or visual story. Thus it require different technique and handling between photos product with normal human eye perspective and smaller objects perspective of such as characters on toy products. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.
References: Giwanda, G., (2001) Menciptakan Foto Yang Menarik, , Puspaswara tt, Jakarta; Giwanda, G., (2001) Panduan Belajar Fotografi, , Puspaswara tt, Jakarta
